N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง LI 4.5 - Savings bank investments in bank holding companies

State Regulations

The department was asked whether section
235
(26)(c)
of the Banking Law proscribed savings
banks and savings and loan associations from investing in common stock of bank
holding companies. The department responded that the purpose of section
235(26)(c) is to prevent savings banks from investing in institutions with
which they compete and that this legislative intent would be thwarted if
savings institutions were allowed to invest in bank holding companies. Accordingly, the department expressed its view that such investments were
improper. DATED: March 12, 1969
